Articles.Content:
I've downloaded 1.4.1 several times, both the .zip file and the installer from the store. When I try to unpack/install, I get error messages that the file is corrupted.

Here's the log of one of the tries:

Spoiler

\Downloads\ksp-win64-1.4.1.zip: Checksum error in KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\Managed\UnityEngine.dll. The file is corrupt
\Downloads\ksp-win64-1.4.1.zip: Checksum error in KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\sharedassets2.assets. The file is corrupt
\Downloads\ksp-win64-1.4.1.zip: Checksum error in KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\sharedassets4.assets.resS. The file is corrupt
\Downloads\ksp-win64-1.4.1.zip: Checksum error in KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\sharedassets9.assets.resS. The file is corrupt
\Downloads\ksp-win64-1.4.1.zip: The archive is corrupt

I've never experienced this problem with any of the previous versions, and downloads from other sites turn out just fine. Do you have any tips on where the problem could be?

Thanks :-)

I have had the exact same problem. When trying to extract the .zip file or the using the installer, it would always warn about corrupted files, and then say the error code was with undisclosed file. I want to play making history REEEEEEEEE.

I should have gotten the game from Steam

On 3/18/2018 at 5:15 PM, ItsBlitz said:

I have had the exact same problem. When trying to extract the .zip file or the using the installer, it would always warn about corrupted files, and then say the error code was with undisclosed file. I want to play making history REEEEEEEEE.

I should have gotten the game from Steam 

I've figured out a solution: Usually, I'm using Firefox, but downloading through Edge somehow worked, although I'm not sure why.
